purpose: Defines strict rules for Canonical JSON serialization required prior to cryptographic signing to ensure deterministic hashing across implementations.

rules.description: Key sorting must be lexicographically ordered based on byte representation (UTF-8).
Whitespace, indentation, and trailing commas are strictly prohibited.
All strings must be encoded in strict UTF-8.
Numbers must be serialized without exponential notation or leading/trailing zeros not necessary for value accuracy.
Null, true, and false must use standard lowercase representation.

reference: JCS (JSON Canonicalization Scheme) equivalent implementation approach.
